Description: This workshop will describe applications of artificial intelligence to cancer imaging. The workshop will begin with an overview centered on common applications, including how artificial intelligence can be applied at various steps in the image-analysis pipeline, including image reconstruction, segmentation, and subsequent uses of image-derived biomarkers for prognosis, treatment recommendation. Potential advantages and disadvantages relative to manual or semi-manual methods will be highlighted. In addition, the workshop will include detailed examples of applications of artificial intelligence for prognosis, based on image-derived biomarkers; these biomarkers may be derived from neural network features, or from radiomics. An example application, to risk stratification for prostate-cancer patients, will illustrate this approach.
Location: New Orleans Theater A, Convention Center

Title: Artificial Intelligence in Cancer Imaging
